items.content:
M&S (which stands for Management and Solutions) was conceived in 2002 with the vision of creating highly effective teams of elite consultants to deliver strategic process and technology solutions to enterprise organizations across the US. Our commitment to delivery in complex environments and long-term customer success has merged process and technology into innovative solutions, established deep pockets of expertise, and enabled innovative transformation for evolving businesses.

We have intentionally cultivated steady growth focused on being approachable and helpful to our dearly valued clients and closely cared-for employees. M&S people simply â€œcare hardâ€, and this reflects in our work products, our interactions, and our culture.

Role Overview:

The Salesforce Developer is a pivotal role in our Salesforce practice in order to work with our clients to achieve their strategic goals. This role will require you to apply your experience to deliver acute development excellence by way of advisory services, consulting and hands-on execution, across Salesforce's suite of products both current and future.

The Salesforce Developer will work directly with clients throughout the development lifecycle - design, program, test, deploy, enhance and support/maintenance of Salesforce.com solutions needed by our clients. The ideal candidate for this role would be comfortable working within the Salesforce framework and able to troubleshoot and problem solve quickly with a strong sense of urgency, attentive to detail and committed to testing, and able to communicate well with business partners. Additionally, this role would actively participate and contribute in solution estimating and planning in collaboration with other M&S Consulting roles. The role has a strong focus on people interaction, and your own personal and professional growth.

Required Skills:

This particular project has a restriction to US Citizens only.5 Years of experience with Visualforce and implementing these into internal salesforce and communities5 Years of experience with Apex CodeExperience with CommunitiesExperience with Lightning Framework and event based web frameworksExperience with Javascript and JQueryExperience integrating apex with external web services using SOAP and REST based communicationExperience with modifying apex code in a salesforce organization with a large Apex code base. Specifically, following existing code base design patterns to best fit a solution.Experience with Agile/Scrum based development approaches.Responsible for ensuring our CRM delivery services satisfy, and advance our client's needs and objectives while adhering to the highest standards and best practices.

Preferred Skills:

Expertise with Salesforce.com and a strong background with implementation, development, and administration.The client wishes to enhance an existing application that is not in production and place it into production and optimize the usage of the Salesforce platform to drive maximum value from our Salesforce investment.Strong Salesforce development skills. Salesforce solution development experience to include configuring Salesforce, working with Salesforce API's and developing customizations (i.e. using Apex). Experience working with the various Salesforce environments (e.g. promoting code from the sandbox to production). Good understanding of the various Salesforce licenses, communities and best practices for Salesforce development.Broad based experience in designing, prototyping, and building custom data centric web-based applications in MS, DB2 and Oracle based client/server environments.Work with business users on helping to develop requirements and functionality that is desired by the business, so excellent communication skills are a must.

Travel is not typically required, but client dependent (up to 100% flexibility)

Position is for anywhere in the United States

items.title: Salesforce Developer Technical Lead (Spokane, WA/Remote) - ActiveSoft,
items.content:
Position: Salesforce Developer Technical Lead
Location: Spokane, WA/Remote
Duration: 12 Month+
Mode of interview: Video interview

Must have Skills : Sales cloud, Vlocity, APEX, Visual force, Lightning (LWC).

â€¢ Vlocity cloud - Energy and Utilities experience is must!
â€¢ Prefer to have multi cloud (Sales, Service, Community) experience
â€¢ Ability to perform administrator functions such as user management, profile configuration, data management, etc.
â€¢ Experience in developing Lightning components in Salesforce is a must.
â€¢ Experience with Salesforce.com development involving creation of custom objects and fields and their relationship with standard objects.
â€¢ Extensive experience in developing visual force pages in salesforce.
â€¢ Extensive experience with APEX programming in salesforce
â€¢ Good understanding of salesforce data structures, objects, SOQL, data access tools like developer workbench, data loader etc.
â€¢ Experience in migrating code from sandboxes to production, validating deployments, resolving deployment issues.
â€¢ Experience in creating complex reports and dashboards in salesforce.
â€¢ Experience in setting up user profiles / roles and organizing hierarchies and security models in salesforce.
â€¢ Experience in developing custom workflow rules, time based workflows, process builder flows, batch processes, triggers in Salesforce.
â€¢ Experience in integrating with Salesforce with other systems.
â€¢ Experience in writing REST APIs in Salesforce
â€¢ Excellent written and oral communication skills
â€¢ Ability to perform impact analysis independently when enhancing existing solutions

items.content:
Senior Salesforce Commerce Cloud/Demandware digital developer required to help architect and implement small to large solutions within the full SFCC technology stack. You will be responsible for informing the business of feasibility, timelines and potential risks as well as being well-versed in back-end development such as API integrations or SFCC jobs, but able to handle complex, front-end experiences as well.
Being self-directing, highly motivated and creative you are a true problem solver!
In return you will have the opportunity to join an established, yet growing, e-commerce team that are pushing the boundaries of the SFCC platform, and having some fun whilst doing it.
Role Responsibilities:
Building solid HTML/CSS, cross-browser, cross-device compatible pages Developing and maintaining optimized Demandware templates and pipelines/controllers Drive initiatives to continually enhance and optimize the front and back-end e-commerce codebase for speed and flexibility Architecting high-level code structures / pattern usage Troubleshooting bugs within a complex, global code base
Qualifications:
5+ years of experience as a web developer, 3+ years Demandware/SFCC required Mastery of XHTML, CSS, JavaScript; Cross-browser compatibility, W3C compatibility Significant experience creating new logic in at least one back-end coding language Architected and lead completion of several large projects (integrations, APIs, refactoring, etc.) Familiarity with code repository systems, Git preferred Experience with JavaScript Frameworks such as jQuery Understanding of and experience with mobile and web-based design constraints, editors, browser platforms and their differences A full role description is available on request.
This role can be entirely remote with 2 or 3 site visits (fully expensed) per year for important project milestones etc.
Salary up to $120K + bonus & excellent benefits.
If this sounds like something that you would be interested in please return a resume now for a prompt response. Interviews available for immediate start.
I look forward to speaking with you in due course.

items.content:
Company Description

Computer Consultants International , Inc. (CCI) is an IT Consulting Firm with more than 18 years experience providing effective, expert-level services in industries such as Construction, Technology, Finance, Healthcare, and Government. CCI focuses on building long-term relationships while completing projects from design to delivery. People are CCI's key component for success. Recruiting utmost-quality individuals for our clients, CCI fields a workforce of individuals who are selected not only because of their technical qualifications but also for their achievements as substantial, contributing human beings. In government work and in the commercial market, high standards of ethics and accountability are critical. Therefore our people are chosen for their integrity and ability to maintain relationships, as well as expertise in their field. To learn more about CCI, visit us online at .
Job Description

CCI has a Client who is seeking Contractors interested in developing a prototype for Phase 1 of an Agriculture Information Management System (AIMS) lands using the Salesforce platform.
If the prototype is successful, the Agency may elect, at its own discretion, to implement and even build on some of the configuration developed during Phase 1 to further implement AIMS functionalities (Phase 2, 3 and 4).
Client is responsible for managing over 1.1 million acres of Trust Lands and water resources available for lease for agriculture and grazing activities. The core of the programs business activities revolves around the management and administration of more than 1,600 active leases, a diverse water portfolio, and a commodity program.
Client agricultural lease process consists of many interrelated or loosely related sub‑processes contained within a complex environment. Much of the complexity is due to statutory requirements and factors outside of Client control. Parcels have numerous improvements, buildings, crops, water rights, grazing, and much more contained within them that must be tracked, reviewed, documented and/or measured. Leases themselves are complex legal documents that require multi stage approvals, careful construction, and communication with outside parties. While there is inherent complexity, the process in use today adds complications of its own, which have grown over time: Several independently designed and developed enterprise systems, which act as data silos. Complex workflows orchestrated via spreadsheets and email as the primary tracking, status and notification tools. Lack of process uniformity across regions. Lack of overall visibility at every level. To implement a streamlined Agriculture Information Management System (AIMS), the Program needs to implement document management best practices, automate document generation through leveraging existing corporate databases, provide solutions for managing a water portfolio and a commodity program, and integrate the various business activities within a unified environment to address workflow challenges.
The Program envisions the software solution: To be built on the Salesforce platform - a cloud based solution. To be highly configurable and require minimum custom development. To connect and consume data from DNR's corporate databases (Oracle, SAP). To leverage the Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI) technology to view and query spatial information. To be compatible with mobile technology (Android, iOS) to support field based data collection associated with site inspections in a disconnected environment (data syncing features). Scope of Work
This project is divided into four separate and distinct phases, each with its own set of objectives and deliverables. As each phase concludes, detailed objectives and deliverables will be re-adjusted based on the previous phase's accomplishments.
Phase 1: Prototype Development
Software prototyping is the activity of creating a version of a segment of the software being developed. It is expected that the Contractor will implement a working prototype as a proof-of concept to demonstrate how the proposed technology and solution can be used to develop AIMS.
The DNR and the Contractor will work together to select a subset of functionalities listed in Appendix 1 for Module 1 and 2 to implement into the prototype.
Phase 2: Module 1 and 2 Implementation
This phase is considered the Core Modules of the system and is contingent on the outcome of the Prototype Development in Phase 1. They represent the largest win for DNR since their implementation brings modern best practice based content management and business process workflow capabilities to a largely manual and ad‑hoc process. They also form a foundation for future efficiency work within Agency.
Module 1. Content Management, Storage, and Contract Document Automation
To be built on content management best practices and leveraging modern tooling to provide an enhanced user experience. The module contains three parts: Content Management, Content Storage, and Contract Document Automation. Working documents associated with parcels and contracts will be housed in a central unified database accessed through a web based interface. Database will allow users to search and retrieve information relevant to active contracts and enter information to progress through the contract administration and management lifecycle. A document automation feature will allow users to create contract documents based on a user generated library of contract provisions (parts) with configured security around parts to allow or prevent modification. Contract documents will be automatically generated by a user based on associated lease type populating with Metadata entry and/or data existing in NaturE, selecting unique parts, populating data object fields, and automatically generating the contract document. Maintenance, editing, and construction of contract provisions, and data fields necessary for metadata entry will be easily configurable inhouse by the system administrator.
Module 2. Workflow Routing and Filing
Module 1 and 2 combined will replace many manual processes, allow for work to be conducted in the field within a mobile environment, provide connectivity across the Programs business processes, and ensure correct links and relationships between all documents and user interactions that make up a lease file will be managed together as a set. The combination of data and relationships that make up the data model is core to providing increased visibility and search functionality the Program desires. The solution will replace the need for staff to maintain spreadsheet based personal tracking mechanisms existing independent of the business enterprise requiring redundant data entry. The module will address tracking to show document location, at-a-glance dashboards of work queues, and task lists. The solution should provide modern workflow rich functionality, complex participant chains, audit trail, sending work "backwards" for corrections without rejecting outright, version control, implementation of deadlines, reminder system, actionable e-mail notifications, parallel assignments, random QA checks as well as electronic signatures.
Phase 3: Module 3 Implementation the Commodity Management
The Commodity Program process is a combination of several different business activities such as procurement, logistics, accounts payable, and accounts receivable. The commodities management process is largely created in-house and does not provide visibility into the process for effective means of reporting on the transactions and data therein. Management challenges arise because the program blends areas such as creation of suppliers, creating invoices, and paying invoices which are traditionally managed by different levels of authority. Module 3 will address the core inventory and sales of commodities by moving away from a spreadsheet-based approach isolated from the business enterprise with a solution that will allow greater controls and visibility into the process. Much of the work in the commodities program is orthogonal to the work on agricultural leases. For those areas where close involvement with the lease process is necessary, this module will integrate with Module 2 to allow for commodity staff involvement as needed in the process. During design and implementation of the Module 2, the participation of the Commodity Specialist should be included as work performed in that module.
Phase 4: Module 4 Implementation of the Water Portfolio Management
Water portfolio management considerations are similar to the commodity program process wise. While water portfolio activities are included in the lease management and administration process itself, there are many other actions associated with water that may happen at any point during the lifecycle of the lease as well as activities that happen independent of the leasing process. Current management process involves a hybrid use of spreadsheets, SharePoint, and physical files. The Program utilizes existing outside databases administered through the Washington State Department of Ecology. These databases are integral for the management of the water portfolio, The Water Program module consists of two parts, mobile data collection and database management for tracking/reporting.
Qualifications A minimum of three (3) years of recent experience with advanced technical architecture for complex Salesforce development. A minimum of three (3) years of recent experience and demonstrative knowledge, skills and abilities developing and implementing workflow..... click apply for full job details

items.title: 2 SAP ABAP Developers (Remote)
items.content:
Planet 121's client, is looking for an SAP Business Process Analyst to join their team. This position is a contract to hire basis and will convert after a 3 month contract period. This position is mostly remote but occasional onsite travel will be required.
US citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply because we are unable to transfer or sponsor H1b candidates now.

Qualifications
At least 10 years of experience of SAP ABAP Development Must have experience with modules SD, PP, MM, WM and FICO Experience with SAPScript and Dynpro ABAP a must Must have excellent communication skills
Planet 121 Company Description
Planet 121 is an internationally recognized IT Consulting Services firm established since 2003 with a specialty in SAP, Cloud Solutions & Big Data. We understand the marketplace and pride ourselves on serving IT candidates as individuals, not commodities. We recognize a candidate's personalized skills and can match them with both direct end clients and select consulting partners.

Additional Information
If you are interested, please respond to this ad with an updated resume and a summary of your skills. We look forward to hearing from you soon. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
*SAP is the trademark of SAP AG in Germany and in several other countries

items.title: Salesforce Developer - Remote/Teleocmmute, Anywhere in the US
items.content: Salesforce Developer - Remote/Teleocmmute, Anywhere in the US TTEC is seeking a SalesforceDeveloper to join our Technology Services team. This role is a telecommutingopportunity with travel requirements up to 25% nationwide. Why choose TTEC to enhance andbroaden your career? We are just as passionate about providing idealsolutions to solving our client's business problems by driving customerexperience outcomes with our enhanced technical capabilities, as you are. Whether you're the Engineer, Architect, Account Manager, Practice Leader orSales Executive we need your talent to help us in our exciting journey tosuccess! What you'll be doing: The Salesforce Developer is intendedto drive the Technical side of the integrated solutions provided to ourclients. The Developer must be passionate about solving businesschallenges and determining solutions. This position will analyze, design,develop, configure, integrate and launch new solutions and changes to existingsolutions. This role will work heavily with Management, Operations, Clients andother development teams to accomplish the goals for multiple implementations. What you'll bring to us: Ability to identify, build and integrate varioustechnologies to provide client solutions and associate applications usingSalesForce.com and other technologies Create high quality solutions for clients Develop solutions based on specifications as indicated indesign Create and maintain positive relationships with multipleinternal groups to support on-going project development Work and collaborate with project teams consisting of theProfessional Services staff, client resources, contract resources and 3rdparty vendors. Participate in all appropriate product, sales, andprocedural training and certification to acquire and maintain the knowledgenecessary to be effective in the position. Achieve and Maintain Service Cloud Consultant and DeveloperCertifications Ability to effectively deliver results on severaldevelopment projects in the same sprints What skills you'll need: B.S. Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS orequivalent work experience 2-3 years of Implementation, Design, and Configurationexperience within Salesforce is required Experience with Salesforce platform - Sales/Service cloud,Force.com, Administration/Configuration, Apex, Force.com APIs, data loads Basic understanding of the overall Architecture ofSalesforce platform Experience with Agile methodology Ability to work as part of a team to solve technicalproblems in varied political and geographic environments Ability to travel up to 25% Who We Are: TTEC is a pioneer in customerexperience, engagement and growth solutions. Our 40,000+ employees servecustomers in more than 80 countries and 50 languages across social, mobile, anddigital channels. We utilize a holistic approach, applying solutionsfrom our four customer experience segments-Consulting, Technology, Care andGrowth-to help companies provide an amazing experience to their customers,inspire customer loyalty, and grow their business. Our employees live by a setof customer-focused values that guide relationships with clients, theircustomers and each other. Our Customer Technology Servicessegment drives customer experience outcomes to small, medium and enterpriseclients by providing best in class Cloud and Premise Contact Center and UnifiedCommunications Solutions, and CRM, Multi-channel, Omni-channel and WFOServices. What We Offer: Variable incentive bonus plan, 401K company match, tuitionreimbursement Global career mobility, employee recognition programs,professional development State of the art technology which allows for seamless globalconnectivity Rich wellness program and health incentives TTEC requires all employees hired in the United States to successfully pass a background check and depending on location and client program a drug test, as a condition of employment. TeleTech is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=13, c=10, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=29}
items.content:
Join Our Team!

We are Plus+, for 20 years, our company has believed in the transformative power of information to help people and businesses thrive. We empower our clients by focusing on their business objectives in order to deliver appropriate holistic technology solutions, bridging the gap between business and technology.

Our Culture is dynamic!

We are committed to being a "People First" organization and we strongly believe that the success of our team also empowers our organization to excel as a whole. Plus+ is consistently recognized as a "Best Workplace" by Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, has been featured as one of "Pittsburgh's Coolest Offices" by Biz Journal and was also a finalist for "Culture Leader of the Year" by the Pittsburgh Technology Council. Our fun and collaborative culture encourages our people to do their best work every day and we strive to recognize individuals on their strengths by providing opportunities for growth, including certifications and continuing education. We take pride in enabling our people to make decisions daily that contribute to their career, wellness & confidence.

What's Your Role:

Plus is seeking a Senior Consultant/Developer, that will contribute to identifying, communicating, and solving highly visible business practices, processes, and technology issues for our clients. The Senior Consultant/Developer will participate in delivering business solutions in a team oriented, collaborative environment. The focus of the senior consultant is to participate in design, solution architecture, technical architecture, and development and implementation efforts of business solutions.

How You'll Contribute:

Provides consulting services

Guides clients and team members to resolve requirements of varying complexity Determines implementation options using best practices approach Architects technical solutions to the appropriate needs of the client, based on Salesforce platform and client IT environment, both internally and cloud based Analyzes client data requirements and interprets into migration and/or integration transformation specifications Develops, unit tests and modifies Apex code using structured methodology Develops and deploys solutions that meet client requirements in a scalable and repeatable manner Provides clear and concise estimates to sales and delivery teams

Communicates clearly and consistently

Provides ongoing communication to team members, management and clients Communicates with clients to provide updates on inquiries across projects and support initiatives Participates in team meetings and updates internal systems in a timely manner

Meets professional standards

Develops quality deliverables and provides guidance to others on deliverables Adheres to project deadlines and commitments Exceeds customer expectations of professionalism Strives to remain technically proficient in technology innovations

Acts as a client advocate

Understands business value in solutions Balances client requirements against competing efforts and project risk factors

What's Needed for Success: (Skills/Experience/Education)

Required Skills:

Experience with custom development using the Force.com platform including Apex, Visualforce, SOQL and SOSL Experience with Java, C#, C++, .NET or other related languages, and experience with developing enterprise applications Experience with relevant scripting, mark-up & styling languages (JavaScript, HTML, XML, CSS, etc.) Proficiency in Salesforce.com declarative configuration Skilled at analyzing, troubleshooting and solving problems Experience with development methodologies and concepts Understanding of enterprise solution architecture as it pertains to scalability, systems integration, etc. Extensive experience with relevant IDEs, deployment methodologies, and system testing Demonstrated ability to learn quickly in a rapid-paced environment Excellent bidirectional verbal and written communication skills Experience using common business applications (Microsoft Office Suite) Strong desire to learn new industries and technologies Ability to adapt to new challenges Ability to prioritize tasks, work on multiple assignments, and manage ambiguity Ability to work both independently and as a part of a team with professionals at all levels

Preferred Skills:

Salesforce.com certification (Platform Developer) Experience working with modern MV* JavaScript frameworks (Angular, Backbone, Ember) Understanding of web design and related web services (particularly REST and SOAP) Required Experience: 3+ years working as a business consultant or technical liaison in an internal or external capacity 2+ years leading CRM system implementation efforts using an SDLC methodology

Education:

Bachelors of Science or Bachelors of Arts degree (Computer Science, Engineering or MIS preferred) Relevant product & technology certifications

Learn more about our Careers:

Current management process involves a hybrid use of spreadsheets, SharePoint, and physical files. The Program utilizes existing outside databases administered through the Washington State Department of Ecology. These databases are integral for the management of the water portfolio, The Water Program module consists of two parts, mobile data collection and database management for tracking/reporting.
Qualifications A minimum of three (3) years of recent experience with advanced technical architecture for complex Salesforce development. items.content:
Title: Lead Salesforce Developer

Duration: 6 +Month

Interview: Phone and Skype

Location: Detroit MI

From the Manager in Detroit - Here are the list of skills I am looking for in a developer

1) In-depth knowledge of APEX, Visualforce, SOQL and Salesforce Lightning.

2) Familiarity and strong knowledge on Web services development which includes REST & SOAP, JSON & XML, etc.

3) Development experience with Salesforce lightning components, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS and knowledge of Lightning web components(optional).

4) Familiarity working with Informatica teams for coordinating data related developments and issue debugging.

5) Experience using GitHub or automation tools for deployments and familiarity with Auto Rabbit would be a big plus.

6) Experience using Salesforce tools like Data-loader or import wizard to do data loads.

7) Strong knowledge on Salesforce standard, custom objects and good understanding of relationships between objects.

8) Salesforce Administrator and Salesforce Platform App Builder certified.

9) Experience with Agile methodology project organization (Scrum) and ability to convert business requirements into Salesforce functionality.

10) Experience using out of the box Salesforce automation tools like Process builder, workflows, visual workflows and validation rules.

11) Effective communication, interpersonal skills and ability to debug and resolve complex scenarios.

Thanks & Regards

Satendra Singh

Ekodus Inc.

371 Hoes Lane, STE 231 Piscataway, NJ 08854

items.content: As we always say Above all, Z3 Technologies Inc. is a company of people who care: who cares about doing the right thing, the right way, for the right reasons. We are looking for Sr. NetSuite Developer (Remote) Role: NetSuite Developer (candidate must have experience in marketplace.)Location: Remote - Limited travel for a few meetingsDuration: Long term Contract role to lead an e-commerce marketplace program. The person will need to: Function at the level of a Senior Program Manager/CIO/CTO including executive communications Oversee the detailed requirements gathering Serve in a Solution Architect role to determine the appropriate design to meet client requirements Assist with selecting a package of vendors/products to enable that design Oversee the implementation from a quality and problem resolution perspective to achieve the business vision & technical design Serve as the principal adviser to the CEO & Board during the program Application general description: Have multiple companies participating in the program (as a co-op) under the guidance of the marketplace entity (similar to the way Amazon has products "sold by" and "fulfilled by" different companies on their website). A marketplace for existing and new customers to purchase equipment and consumables Show prices from the various participating warehouses/companies for customer comparison, and allow the customer to select the one that they want to buy from Price the order including applicable sales tax and any shipping charges Track inventory availability from co-op members' systems to satisfy potential orders (ATP) Fulfill the orders from one of the multiple warehouses depending on "best fit"/customer selection Transfer the order to the co-op member's order fulfillment system for pick/pack/ship The co-op marketplace site will process the payments and notify the participant company when to ship The marketplace will also handle the creation of Return Authorizations, order cancellations, etc., and notify the co-op member for action Allow for purchases of other items like extended warranties, installation services, etc. If Interested please share the profile to jaiz3tech.com with below detailsTotal Exp:Rel Exp:EDOJ:VISA TYPE:EAD (YES/NO):RELOCATION:

Salesforce Lightning Developer - (Remote Role)

6+ Months

Job Responsibilities:

Salesforce Lightning Developer (8+ yrs experience, strong in Lightning, Service cloud, aura framework etc)

Description PURPOSE:

This position designs, develops, tests and implements business application solutions using the Salesforce platform tools and technologies. The scope of the applications will vary in size and complexity from department level to enterprise wide and may be internally focused within Andersen Corporation or externally focused to support a variety of customer channels.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the design, development, testing, deployment and documentation of applications
  • Work closely with business customers to understand, define and document business requirements, functional requirements and design requirements
  • Work closely with process owners in the design phase to leverage technology to support business process improvements
  • Design, development and testing methods and techniques must meet corporate IT standards as well as industry best practices
  • Work with IT infrastructure staff and PMO staff to ensure the successful delivery of the application
  • Accurately estimate the design, development, testing and deployment of the application
  • Completes comprehensive unit and system testing of application, its components and interfaces
  • Support and maintain applications from a customer and technology perspective
  • Support other application developers on technical issues and assisting with their development efforts
  • Research and develop skills in new technologies
  • Successfully provide direction and oversight to contracted external development vendors
  • Provide technical and user application documentation
  • Provide user training as required

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related discipline
  • Minimum of 8+ years of development experience with the Salesforce platform .
  • Experience implementing requirements on the Salesforce platform and Force.com IDE plug-in using Eclipse or, preferably, Welkin Suite
  • Experience developing complex Apex classes, controller classes, Apex triggers, and custom logic using Apex batch classes
  • Able to develop custom wizards using Visualforce pages and custom controllers
  • Experience writing custom formula fields and validation rules
  • Experience creating Visualforce pages, page layouts, custom links, related lists and other components
  • Lightning development experience particularly using Lightning Web Components is strongly desired
  • Experience with Salesforce sandbox testing and code migration
  • Experience with Salesforce communities
  • Ability to create and customize Salesforce dashboards
  • Experience using Git-based source control tools within a team
  • DevOps experience in a Salesforce environment is strongly desired
  • Experience with Field Service Lightning is strong desired
  • Salesforce developer certification is desired
  • Interact with team members to help gather and document requirements
  • Familiar with a variety of application development methodologies including SDLC, Agile and Scrum
  • Experience developing web applications that are customer facing
  • Experience with database technologies including SQL and Oracle
  • Able to work independently as well as in a team environment
  • Able to deliver high quality solutions
  • Able to manage and prioritize several tasks and projects
  • Strong problem-solving skills and able to generate creative solutions
  • Strong focus on customer service and goes the extra mile to ensure a positive customer experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

items.content:
Job Role: Salesforce Developer
Job Location: Stanford, CA (Remote role)
Job duration: Long-term

Description:

As a Salesforce Developer, you'll be a core member of the development team supporting our internal systems. While the SFDC platform will be your technical focus, you'll be willing and able to be relied on by leadership to discuss IT roadmap, provide feedback, and receive ideas from. Working closely with others on the tech teams, you'll build, test, iterate and deploy changes supporting technical maintenance, ongoing enhancements to existing features, and new functionality such as integrations, portal application modules, or automated business processes. You'll play a leading role in understanding end user interactions with SFDC apps and be able to put him/herself in their shoes. items.content:
Job Title: Salesforce Developer

Location: Remote

Duration: 12+Months

Job Description:

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  • Works on projects that may span a broad range of systems. Requires expertise in multiple technical environments and possesses an increased level of business knowledge.
  • Responsibilities include, but may not be limited to, the following:
  • Consults in the project planning process with customers, IT business analysts, architects and team members.
  • Organizes and documents technical requirements. Creates technical design specifications and assists in sizing technical requirements.
  • Works with customers to develop and analyze application packages and tools and determine optimum functionality requirements to meet those needs. Evaluates new application packages and tools.
  • Provides multiple recommendations for the solutions.
  • Evaluates existing applications and platform and provides recommendations for system enhancements by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications.
  • Participates on teams that outline the process and scope out the improvements that can be realized through the application solution.
  • May lead the deployment of new modules, upgrades and fixes.
  • Implements integration plans. Interfaces with testing teams to incorporate plans into integration testing process.
  • Defines, develops or modifies software application modules or enterprise wide software systems using disciplined development processes.
  • Identifies better sources of data feeds and interfaces with architects to ensure their feasibility with corporate data warehouse, when needed.
  • Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules, test activities/results and other areas such as error handling and backup/recovery procedures.
  • Adheres to quality standards and procedures. Reviews modules for quality assurance and checks compliance with application architecture standards and SLAs.
  • May assist in defining development guidelines and standards to be utilized in software development/integration.
  • Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.
  • Provides ongoing maintenance of applications.
  • May produce and analyze data extracts from system based on user requirements.
  • Assists in the development of user guides and training documentation.
  • Provides technical leadership coaching and mentoring to team members. Provides technical guidance or system process expertise.
  • Develops reports and presentations for senior management, as needed.
  • Developing Salesforce Apps and/or Community pages for assigned projects
  • Performing thorough Peer Code Review
  • Troubleshoot and solve Incident tickets
  • Perform critical review of User Stories and technical design alignment
  • Maintain adherence to Platform and Coding standards

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or business management and 7-10 years experience.
  • 4-6 years' experience as a hands-on developer and architect within the Salesforce domain with proven track record in delivering complex projects
  • Expertise creating and integrating Salesforce External Services, External Objects and use of Salesforce Connect using OData with internal APIs and micro-services
  • Experience with Release Management, Source Control, and Deployment concepts and technologies such as ANT, SFDC Metadata API, Jenkins, SVN
  • Development using VisualForce, APEX, triggers, Classes, Java Script, Lightning API.
  • Hands-on mobile development experience
  • Extensive experience programming and/or systems analysis experience. Have a broad level of understanding surrounding information systems and application architecture standards.
  • Perform development of customer enhancements, and maintenance tasks using expertise with SQL Server, Oracle, VB .Net, and SSRS.
  • Ability to work well under deadlines and in a flexible environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to perform all essential functions. (See above)
  • Must have leadership skills, experience/in-depth knowledge of business operations and systems requirements processes including ability to measure short- and long-term business goals.
  • Must possess the ability to utilize adaptable communication skills to effectively translate between technical and business language.
  • Must possess the skill to educate project team members on business unit goals and objectives and educate the business on the value of information technology.
  • Ability to identify, propose and oversee the execution of business solutions as well as interpret
  • documents communicating business needs and requirements.
  • Must possess the skill to assess the client needs through direct interaction, and identify opportunities to develop the business through effective use of technology.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Willingness to support applications 24 x 7 (24 hours a day, 7 days a week)
  • The successful candidate will have proven experience with:
  • Service Cloud, Community Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Sales Cloud, Force.com
  • Role Based Access Control, and Permission Sets
  • Lightning Container, Lightning UX Builder
  • Lightning Flow including Process Builder and Cloud Flow Designer
  • Platform Events, Async REST, Sync REST, and Continuation Framework (integration)
  • Salesforce DX (dev hub)
  • Platform App Builder, Platform Developer, Data Architecture and Management Designer and Integration Architecture domains
  • Salesforce Visualforce, Apex, SOQL/SOSL
  • Wave and Einstein Analytics

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Salesforce Certified Advanced Administrator
  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I
  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer II
  • Salesforce Certified App Builder
  • Salesforce Certified Advance Administrator
  • Salesforce Certified community consultant
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent communication skills - both oral and written
  • Background in transportation or logistics
  • Knowledge with Sencha 4 or higher
  • Knowledge with Java
  • Knowledge of Websphere

Please send us the resume s to ramesh(at)pcservicesinc(dot)com

Georgia Institute of Technology

 

Application Developer II (salesforce)


US-only
**Job Purpose**: Perform intermediate level system analysis, definition and design activities often of a complex nature for new software applications. Modify and maintain existing applications. **Major Responsibilities**: * Consult with users, analyze requirements and recommend technical design and specifications. * Develop, test and implement technical solutions. * Modify and maintain existing applications. * Prepare technical, operational and user related documentation in support of applications. * Provide technical support and training to functional users * Perform other related duties as assigned. **Basic Qualifications**: *  **Education**: Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience *  **Work Experience**: Two to four years job related experience. *  **Certifications**: N/A *  **Skills**: This job requires working knowledge and skills in application of query language, web development tools, procedural development tools, relational databases, structured programming and understanding of the software development life cycle. **Qualifications** **Preferred Qualifications**: *  **Preferred Education**: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field is preferred *  **Preferred Work Experience**: 2 or more years of experience working within an agile team. 2 or more years of experience working with Salesforce or other CRM technologies. *  **Preferred Certifications**: Salesforce Platform Developer I or other Salesforce certifications *  **Preferred Skills**: * Experience and familiarity with these tools or frameworks are preferred:: * Lightning, Angular, React, or general JS experience * Apex, Java, C# .NET, or Python * MVC frameworks such as VisualForce or ASP .NET * git and GitHub or other similar version control tools * SOQL or any SQL variant * REST and SOAP API protocols * Integration tools such as Mulesoft, Zapier, Jitterbit, or Flow * Experience and familiarity with these best practices or methodologies is preferred: * Familiarity working in a CI/CD development environment * Experience with TDD and other software development best practices * Experience with SCRUM, Kanban, or other agile methodologies * Understanding of integration design patterns and best practices * Understanding of software design patterns and best practices **Additional Information**: The CRM Developer is responsible for designing, implementing, testing, and deploying CRM solutions (within the SalesForce.com environment) for Institute organizations. In addition to standard SFDC configuration, the CRM developer will be responsible for developing solutions that may leverage HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, and other technologies. The CRM developer will be responsible for the customization and configuration of standard and non-standard components required to meet business requirements in a very high quality and using software development best practices such as TDD, Agile, version control, and CI/CD. The CRM Developer must be able to communicate well with academic and business units who have varying technical abilities, as well as with staff, contractors, and vendors. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn, have a knack for solving problems, and excited to develop innovative solutions to complex business problems. **Remote candidates will be considered**. **Impact & Influence**: This position will interact on a consistent basis with: Other software developers and analysts, project managers, customers and department management. This position typically will advise and counsel: NA. This position will supervise: NA. **Department Description**  The Salesforce team within the OIT EIS department is a new and rapidly growing team that is focused on bringing innovative solutions to tough business challenges across a variety of stakeholders throughout the Institute. Our team is entrepreneurial, innovative, and collaborative and we solve tough challenges head-on in a supportive and enjoyable working environment. The Office of Information Technology (OIT) provides information technology leadership and support to the Georgia Institute of Technology, working in partnership with academic and business units to meet the unique needs of a leading research university. OIT serves as the primary source of enterprise-wide information technology and telecommunications services in support of students, faculty, staff, and researchers. Services and resources range from operating and maintaining Georgia Tech's leading-edge wired and wireless networks, which provide Internet and research network connectivity, to protecting the integrity of the Institute’s data and critical administrative systems. The Enterprise Information Systems (EIS) Directorate is comprised of several key groups working cooperatively together to implement, enhance and support the strategic institute initiatives and projects related to Georgia Tech’s enterprise administrative/business and academic information systems. **Job**: Information Technology **Primary Location**: Georgia-Atlanta or Remote **Organization**: Office of (OIT) Information Technology **Job Posting**: Sep 4, 2019, 1:19:18 PM **Hiring Range**: N/A **Schedule**: Full-time #Salary $75000 #Location - US-only

Job description

Senior Salesforce Developer

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM, BI, and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality. 

Duties

  • Participate in the development of  Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects
  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek’s Jr. and mid-level resources
  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables with the EC team
  • Participate in pre-sales efforts and strategic project planning
  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required
  • Additional duties as required

 Required Technical Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent
  • 3+ years experience with end to end Salesforce.com implementations, integrations, and enhancement projects
  • 2+ years APEX and VisualForce development for custom Salesforce functionality
  • Salesforce development certification (highly desired)
  • Hands-on development skills

 Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Apply now

About Eagle Creek Software Services

Founded in 1999, Eagle Creek Software Services provides consulting and technical expertise to the Enterprise. We focus on CRM, Application Development, Data Integration and BI, helping our clients increase quality and efficiency while managing price and risk in software development, deployment and support.

We’re uniquely positioned by combining on site expertise with our U.S. Onshore delivery platforms. This model utilizes on shore but offsite, technology center based resources, in a model that we developed in collaboration with the state governments of North and South Dakota. Through this approach, we are able to achieve consistency and sustainability in the provisioning of technical and consulting capabilities to our clients.

With over 15 years in business and over 5 million hours of experience, Eagle Creek has expertise in a multitude of industries. From Hospitality to Manufacturing, we have the know-how to implement, upgrade or maintain your technology stack. But if you’re in need of a company with a special understanding, a deep industry expertise, we have that also. Some of the areas/sectors that we excel in include Healthcare, Insurance, Financial Services, Communications, Technology, and Life Sciences.

We’re committed to delivering a technology value proposition that positively impacts our customer and to helping you sustain your front office technology investments. Simply stated, you want the highest quality of services, at the most affordable price, where risk is continuously assessed and mitigated. With all of our years of experience we only know one way to achieve this, and that’s through U.S. Onshore. Nine years ago, when everyone was building offshore facilities, we were investing in U.S. Onshore. Today, we are the innovation leader supporting over 40 different technologies, applications and platforms. CRM, Application Development, BI – Salesforce®, Oracle, Birst, Cognos, Informatica, Java, .NET and Drupal – depth of expertise and breadth of experience.

We’re Eagle Creek – the innovative leader in U.S. Onshore.

If you would enjoy working in a dynamic environment and are looking for an opportunity to become part of a stellar team of professionals, we invite you to apply online today. 

Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to sex, race, age, disability, religion, national origin, color or any other protected class.

Benefits

  • Medical
  • PTO
  • Career Development
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401K
  • Life Insurance
  • Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
  • Passionate Teammates

POSITION OVERVIEWXapo is a fast-growing, global fintech company with a mission to build a safe and global way to use money. We’re a fully distributed team, with 250+ Xapiens working from 50+ countries. We’re seeking a collaborative, proactive problem-solver to join us as Salesforce Developer at Xapo. This full-time position is planned to be remote, meaning you can work from anywhere!In this role, you will be responsible for owning and customizing our internal Salesforce platform.The ideal candidate is comfortable taking on ownership in a highly technical environment, resourceful, self-motivated, and passionate about understanding and fulfilling their client’s business requirements.BALANCE FOR BETTERAt Xapo, we embrace our differences and actively foster an inclusive environment where we all can thrive. We’re a flexible, family-friendly environment, and we recognize that everyone has commitments outside of work. We have a goal of reaching gender parity and strongly encourage women to apply to our open positions. Diversity is not a tagline at Xapo; it is our foundation.RESPONSIBILITIES
    Develop, enhance, test, support, maintain and debug software applications that support business units or support functions.Work with internal teams to identify requirements and maintain a development schedule.Analyze/identify gaps in functional/business requirements, discuss required changes with product owners to align with Salesforce product stack and architecture.Develop end to end Salesforce solutions using Apex Class, Triggers, Visualforce pages, Lightning components etc.Write technical approach and design documentation as required.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
    5+ years as a software developer.Knowledge of product development lifecycle.Knowledge of DevOps tools like GIT, Jenkins, JIRA etc.Hands-on development experience using Salesforce configuration and customizations using Apex, triggers, etc.,Experience defining/working with REST APIsOral and written proficiency in English.
PREFERRED SKILLS
    Web development skills.Python language.Scrum experience.Amazon Web Services.Remote work experience.
OTHER REQUIREMENTS
    A dedicated workspace. A reliable internet connection with the fastest speed possible in your area.Devices and other essential equipment that meet minimal technical specifications.Alignment with Our Values.
WHY WORK FOR XAPO?
    Shape the Future: Improve lives through cutting-edge technology, work remotely from anywhere in the worldOwn Your Success: Receive attractive remuneration, enjoy an autonomous work culture and flexible hours, apply your expertise to meaningful work every dayExpect Excellence: Collaborate, learn, and grow with a high-performance team
ABOUT XAPOAt Xapo, we’re building a way for users all over the world to send, receive, spend, and store their money globally and safely. We're firm believers that no matter who you are or where you're from, you deserve easy access to digital financial services. Launched in 2014 by Wences Casares (CEO) & Federico Murrone (COO), Xapo has made an unparalleled investment in security infrastructure, assembled a renowned advisory board, and raised $40M from top venture capital firms in Silicon Valley & the world.Xapo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe a team that represents a variety of backgrounds and perspectives is critical to our success as a global company. A diverse, inclusive workplace enables us to create products that best serve our customers all around the world. It is the foundation of Xapo.

Job description

„Wir verstehen unsere Unternehmung als Ort, an dem Menschen zusammenkommen, um ein starkes gemeinsames Interesse und gemeinsame Werte zu teilen.“
Smart Commerce SE ist ein innovativer Anbieter von eCommerce-Lösungen. Unseren Erfolg verdanken wir in erster Linie unseren Mitarbeitern, die in Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden maßgeschneiderte eCommerce-Lösungen für den Online-Handel planen, bauen und betreiben.

Wir suchen ab sofort für unsere Standorte in Leipzig, Stuttgart Böblingen und Jena oder remote:

(Senior) SAP-Commerce-Cloud-Entwickler ehem. Hybris (m/w/d)

Du bearbeitest, eingebunden in ein interdisziplinäres Team, kontinuierlich bestehende und neue eCommerce Projekte inhouse sowie vor Ort bei unseren Kunden.

Deine Aufgaben:

  • Du entwickelst und wartest kundenspezifische Erweiterungen von SAP Commerce Cloud (ehem. Hybris) Installationen
  • Du machst Aufwandsschätzungen und definierst Arbeitspakete auf Basis vorliegender Anpassungen
  • Du führst technische Dienstleistungspakete durch
  • Du konfigurierst Entwicklungsumgebungen und CI-Systeme
  • Du erstellst technische Spezifikationen
  • In deine Verantwortung fallen ebenfalls objektorientierte Analyse, Design und Entwicklung
  • Abhängig von deinen Erfahrungen, die du mitbringst, führst du ggf.  ein Team von qualifizierten Softwareentwicklern und übernimmst die technische

Dein Profil:

  • Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare technische Qualifikation
  • Du bringst Berufserfahrung als Java-Softwareentwickler und Knowhow in IT-Architekturen mit
  • Du hast einschlägige Erfahrungen mit SAP Commerce Cloud B2C & B2B Commerce Kundenprojekten
  • Du bringst als Voraussetzung auch Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung mit Java Spring & J2EE mit
  • Auch hast du Kenntnisse in Commerce-Cloud-Accelerator oder in der Anbindung von SAP Commerce Cloud an SAP
  • Deine Deutsch- und möglichst auch Englischkenntnisse sind sehr gut in Wort und Schrift

Unser Angebot:

  • Individuell entwickeltes Weiterbildungsprogramm
  • Unternehmensbeteiligungen und Mitbestimmung bis in die höchste Unternehmensebene
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice
  • Teilzeitarbeitsmodelle für deine Work-Life-Balance
  • Lebensarbeitszeitkonto für Sabbaticals o.ä.
  • Individuelle Haustierlösungen
  • Arbeitsumgebung auf dem aktuellsten Stand der Technik
  • Ein sympathisches Team und Vorgesetze, die sich auf deine Ideen freuen
  • Regelmäßige Teamevents
  • Konsequente Anerkennung von Leistungen,
  • Beiträgen und Erfolgen
  • Innovative Projekte, unbürokratische Strukturen und kurze Entscheidungswege

Das erwartet dich:

The “Smart Way” - Gegenseitiges Vertrauen, Offenheit und Ehrlichkeit, Teamarbeit, die Verpflichtung zu Qualität und Exzellenz, Unabhängigkeit und Mitbestimmung sind feste Bestandteile des Smart Way. Diese Werte leiten unsere Mitarbeiter bei der Umsetzung der Unternehmensziele. Der Smart Way definiert wer wir sind und wie wir arbeiten, denken und handeln – er differenziert Smart Commerce am Markt und macht uns zu einem innovativen und besonderen Arbeitgeber.

Du hast Fragen? Unter 03641-3161030 beantwortet dir Evelin Linde, unsere HR Managerin, diese gerne!

Neugierig geworden? Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung mit Angabe deines Gehaltswunsches und deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Du hast Interesse an der Stelle aber gerade keine Zeit für eine ausführliche Bewerbung? Kein Problem, Lass dich anrufen!

Apply now

  • Unternehmensbeteiligungen und Mitbestimmung über Unternehmensaktien
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice

Job description

Senior Salesforce Developer

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM, BI, and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality. 

Duties

  • Participate in the development of  Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects
  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek’s Jr. and mid-level resources
  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables with the EC team
  • Participate in pre-sales efforts and strategic project planning
  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required
  • Additional duties as required

 Required Technical Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent
  • 3+ years experience with end to end Salesforce.com implementations, integrations, and enhancement projects
  • 2+ years APEX and VisualForce development for custom Salesforce functionality
  • Salesforce development certification (highly desired)
  • Hands-on development skills

 Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Apply now

About Eagle Creek Software Services

Founded in 1999, Eagle Creek Software Services provides consulting and technical expertise to the Enterprise. We focus on CRM, Application Development, Data Integration and BI, helping our clients increase quality and efficiency while managing price and risk in software development, deployment and support.

We’re uniquely positioned by combining on site expertise with our U.S. Onshore delivery platforms. This model utilizes on shore but offsite, technology center based resources, in a model that we developed in collaboration with the state governments of North and South Dakota. Through this approach, we are able to achieve consistency and sustainability in the provisioning of technical and consulting capabilities to our clients.

With over 15 years in business and over 5 million hours of experience, Eagle Creek has expertise in a multitude of industries. From Hospitality to Manufacturing, we have the know-how to implement, upgrade or maintain your technology stack. But if you’re in need of a company with a special understanding, a deep industry expertise, we have that also. Some of the areas/sectors that we excel in include Healthcare, Insurance, Financial Services, Communications, Technology, and Life Sciences.

We’re committed to delivering a technology value proposition that positively impacts our customer and to helping you sustain your front office technology investments. Simply stated, you want the highest quality of services, at the most affordable price, where risk is continuously assessed and mitigated. With all of our years of experience we only know one way to achieve this, and that’s through U.S. Onshore. Nine years ago, when everyone was building offshore facilities, we were investing in U.S. Onshore. Today, we are the innovation leader supporting over 40 different technologies, applications and platforms. CRM, Application Development, BI – Salesforce®, Oracle, Birst, Cognos, Informatica, Java, .NET and Drupal – depth of expertise and breadth of experience.

We’re Eagle Creek – the innovative leader in U.S. Onshore.

If you would enjoy working in a dynamic environment and are looking for an opportunity to become part of a stellar team of professionals, we invite you to apply online today. 

Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to sex, race, age, disability, religion, national origin, color or any other protected class.

Benefits

  • Medical
  • PTO
  • Career Development
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401K
  • Life Insurance
  • Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
  • Passionate Teammates

items.content:
Job Description

J2 Interactive is looking for qualified candidates to help us build creative and innovative solutions for our clients using the Salesforce platform. Since 2007, J2 Interactive has been delivering custom applications and large-scale health information exchange implementations for local RHIOs, statewide exchanges, and private health systems. As our team continues to expand the breadth of its service offerings, we're looking for talented, experienced software developers and interoperability experts who bring a knowledge of (or at least, a strong interest in) healthcare as well as deep experience with Salesforce integration and application development.

Though our headquarters is located in Charlestown (Boston), MA, this is a telecommuting position open to anyone who's eligible to work in the US.

Candidates must be willing to submit to a background check. No recruiters or third party solicitations please.

Skills Description

The ideal candidate will be a Solution Architect who has hands-on experience building solutions on the Salesforce.com platform. Desired credentials include:

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills; ability to work directly with clients.
  • In-depth understanding of Salesforce.com's Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Force.com product offerings. Bonus for Health Cloud experience.
  • 5+ years' experience writing Apex, Visualforce pages, S-controls and triggers in the Force.com development environment.
  • A track record in design and development of solutions that connect customers' data with the Salesforce platform and intimate familiarity with the capabilities of the Salesforce web service API.
  • Experience provisioning and administering Salesforce environments in a production setting.
  • A strong background in mobile app and web development including fluency in multiple mainstream programming languages (Java, Javascript, C#, SQL, HTML, HTML5). Knowledge of how to best leverage the tools, frameworks and APIs used to build apps for different devices.
  • Active Salesforce Certifications are desirable.

We're especially looking for people with experience in the U.S. healthcare industry and/or the InterSystems technology platform (Caché/Ensemble/HealthShare), but neither of those things are strictly necessary. The right person will be able to pick things up as long as they have the motivation.

Company Description

J2 Interactive is an award-winning software development and IT consulting firm specializing in customized solutions for hospitals, labs, research institutions, and health information exchanges. Our approach to design and development is rooted in a fundamental belief that systems succeed or fail based on how well they serve the people who depend upon them. For our clients in the healthcare industry, that includes doctors, nurses, technicians, and administrative staff ... but ultimately, it means patients and their families. At J2 we get a lot of satisfaction out of helping our customers succeed, and we want people with that same commitment to getting the job done right. We're not afraid to give people the responsibility of working directly with clients, defining project specs, and choosing implementation strategies. Our casual work environment and telecommuting options give our staff a high quality of life to go along with the technical and creative challenges of the work itself.

Benefits for full-time employees include:

  • The ability to telecommute from your home office

  • Minimal travel on most projects

  • Aggressive employee profit-sharing program

  • Voluntary 401(k) plan with company matching up to 4% of salary

  • Medical, dental and vision insurance, with 50% of costs paid by J2

  • J2 Flex Spending Account to pay for medical expenses on a pre-tax basis

  • Short-term and long-term disability insurance, paid for by J2

  • Laptop and required software

  • Annual ski trip that will make you wonder how you found this awesome company

If you're interested in joining our team, we invite you to submit your resume so we can take a look. We move fast ... so if you've got what we're looking for, you'll be amazed at how quickly you might have yourself a new job that you'll love.

J2 Privacy Policy

- provided by Dice

items.title: ReUp Education: Salesforce Administrator
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Salesforce Administrator

ReUp Education is seeking a skilled Salesforce Admin / Product Manager to own the continued development and maintenance of our internal Coaching and Sales Platforms. These platforms have been key in helping us re-enroll thousands of students, and now is the perfect time for a Salesforce expert to take ownership, prioritize and manage new features, and optimize our platforms in partnership with teams across the organization. By helping us iterate and innovate on our core technologies, you’ll enable ReUp to achieve our ambitious goal of re-enrolling millions of college students and supporting them through to graduation. 

This is an incredible opportunity to play a meaningful role in a growing early-stage startup as we tackle a huge problem that affects a largely underserved population. You will be an integral part in ensuring the rest of our teams can put their time where it matters most to serve our students effectively. If you’re interested in using the power of data, technology, and coaching to transform people’s lives, come join us!

Responsibilities - Salesforce Admin
  • Support internal teams with Salesforce instance configuration, including: creating objects, fields, formula fields, validation rules, workflows, process builder, page layouts, etc.
  • Manage third-party integrations and vendor relationships
  • Proactively evaluate new releases of Salesforce and communicate recommendations appropriately
  • Gather requirements, scope, and execute (or manage) custom Salesforce development projects as needed (e.g. triggers, Apex, flows, custom objects, etc.)
  • Monitor, manage, and coordinate deployments across Salesforce environments
  • Perform data cleanup and data manipulation tasks using Data Loader as needed
  • Log and track identified system problems and work with support teams as needed
  • Manage security related to profiles, permission sets, roles, sharing settings and access policies, in collaboration with the Data team
  • Manage all users and licenses across instances (Coaching and Sales)
Responsibilities - Product Management
  • Work closely with our Head of Product, Head of Coaching Services, and other internal stakeholders as needed
  • Serve as product owner for our Coaching Platform, overseeing the full product lifecycle from discovery > design > dev > testing > deployment > measurement
  • Document user stories, technical requirements, and acceptance criteria
  • Manage the product backlog, plan for upcoming sprints, and run weekly scrum meetings
  • Oversee the continued development of proprietary backend services that integrate into the Coaching Platform
  • Contribute data-informed recommendations to the vision and strategy
Responsibilities - Other
  • Daily support of the Coaching Team and Sales Team in developing and managing their dashboards, reports, listviews, fields, and automations
  • Standardizing the structure and use of reports, dashboards, listviews, email templates, and workflows across instances to enable replicable results
  • Manage all incoming technical issues through ticketing system and Slack
Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in business or technology, or equivalent industry experience
  • Certified Salesforce Administrator with 2-5 years configuration experience; Salesforce developer experience is a big plus
  • Familiarity with agile software development
  • Prior product management experience a plus, but we can provide extensive training here
  • You have stellar communication skills and are able to collaborate with colleagues across departments and geographic locations
  • You are an excellent problem solver and decision-maker
  • You can prioritize multiple projects and competing work demands
  • You are comfortable digging into data and performing analyses
  • You are effective in presenting information across mediums and audiences
  • You have a strong sense of agency and internal drive to accomplish your goals
  • You are intellectually curious and love to learn
  • You are passionate about education and startups (higher ed, ed tech and/or startup experience a big plus)
  • You care about ReUp’s mission and are committed to helping us open new opportunities to students
  • Experience working remotely a plus
Compensation & Benefits
  • Competitive salary (commensurate with experience and location)
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees; we pay 100% of the employee's premium and 50% of any dependents' premiums
  • Flexible time off and remote work opportunity
  • 401(k) plan
  • A diverse team that fosters a high level of collaboration despite being highly distributed
  • We provide your choice of a Mac or PC laptop
